title: Editbar
author: Editbar
content: For anybody wondering how bad this is in terms of the dollar amount stolen, this is one of the biggest hacks of all time if not the biggest.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: Editbar on October 07, 2022, 03:28:12 PMFor anybody wondering how bad this is in terms of the dollar amount stolen, this is one of the biggest hacks of all time if not the biggest.You should not always trust the news, and even if this is the biggest hack currently, I don't think It will be the biggest forever, as the formerly seen and known as impossible is now becoming more possible with technology and some kind of improved knowledge. There is a likelihood to see more hacks in the crypto environment, if not to BNB, maybe another. This attack on BNB should spur others to improve their security against hackers.

comments.author: FriedeFritz
comments.body: This will alter the perception of Binance as a secure place to store anything. I wouldn't be surprised if this is the work of a large organization. Government-sponsored hackers are well-known to target cryptocurrency.Bridges will never be safe, and they are causing a lot of bad press for the entire crypto ecosystem, as at least half of the large hacks reported are the result of bridge flaws.

comments.author: zasad@
comments.body: Quote from: FriedeFritz on October 08, 2022, 05:21:01 PMThis will alter the perception of Binance as a secure place to store anything. I wouldn't be surprised if this is the work of a large organization. Government-sponsored hackers are well-known to target cryptocurrency.Bridges will never be safe, and they are causing a lot of bad press for the entire crypto ecosystem, as at least half of the large hacks reported are the result of bridge flaws.The bridge runs on a smart contract written by people. And since this is a very complex system that combines many smart contracts, hacker attacks are possible. But the trend lately is that the security service finds hackers and they return the money, minus a small payment for the found bug.
